page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES PART 2
page.content: There were many houses. Mr clarke lived in hykeham all his life and he only left when he joined the army.he has had many jobs like a solier and a baker.As a baker Mr.Clark got up at 1 a.m. to make the bread by mixing the ingredients by hand in a wooden trough;16 stone of flour(112kg),and 15 gallons of water (75 litres). It was cooked in an oven over a wooden fire and it took about 2\ to 3 hours to reach the correct temperture The bakery was where the present post office is now .He delivered the bread by horse and cart to Bracebridge,South Hykeham and to Whisby.There were no convenience foods then ,mostly vegtables that they have grown in their own gardens. Every sunday they would have a large joint of meat such as beef or pork that would last for most of the week.
